data.title: Life’s Work: An Interview with Darius Rucker
data.meta_description: When the front man of Hootie & the Blowfish ditched pop music to make country records, he was taking a big risk. Nashville didn’t welcome crossover artists, and an African American hadn’t had a country hit in years. In this interview Rucker describes why he prevailed, how he’s dealt with racism, and what still gets him excited.
data.text:
Alison Beard is an executive editor at Harvard Business Review and previously worked as a reporter and editor at the Financial Times. A mom of two, she tries—and sometimes succeeds—to apply management best practices to her household.
